intro: Rubus potis, commonly known as the alpine blackberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are rich in antioxidants. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and edible fruits.
